Data Structures

class  DBItemIterator

Detailed Description

The DBService class is a base class for service interfaces for data base applications. It is derived from Apoxi class Service. It is intended to be used by SyncML applications as the interface to a data store and therefore has to be implemented by data base applications which want to synchronize their data with other device.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

virtual UINT16 DBService::AddItem (  UINT32 &  item_id,
const void *  item_data,
UINT32  item_data_length,
const SyncMLItemMetaInfo &  item_meta_info
)  [pure virtual]
 

Adds an item to the database. New item id for the item is returned in output parameter item_id.

Parameters:
item_id[out] : The item id for the newly added item.
item_data[in] : Data for the item.
item_data_length[in] : Length of the data for the item.
item_meta_info[in] : Meta information about the data for the item.
Returns:
Returns the response status code of the operation (see Response Status Codes in the SyncML Representation Protocol).

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::ClearDatabase (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Deletes all items from the database.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::CloseDatabase (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Closes the database. Is called by SyncML application after reading and writing the data.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::CommitTransaction (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Commits the transactions and makes all the changes since StartTransaction was called.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual UINT16 DBService::CopyItem (  const UINT32  item_id,
const UINT16  target_location,
UINT32 &  copy_item_id
)  [pure virtual]
 

Makes a copy of the item with id item_id and stores it in the database. Gives back the id of the item copy in copy_item_id.

Parameters:
item_id[in] : The item id for the newly added item.
target_location[in] : The location where the copy should be added.
copy_item_id[out] : The id of the new copy of the item.
Returns:
Returns the response status code of the operation, (see Response Status Codes in the SyncML Representation Protocol).

virtual UINT16 DBService::DeleteItem (  const UINT32  item_id  )  [pure virtual]
 

Deletes the item with item id from the database.

Parameters:
item_id[in] : Item id which is to be deleted.
Returns:
Returns the response status code of the operation (see Response Status Codes in the SyncML Representation Protocol).

virtual DBItemIterator* DBService::GetAllItems (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Gets the iterator for all the item ids in data store.

Returns:
pointer to a DBItemIterator iterator for all items in the data store. If the iterator isn't used any more, it has to be released using Release.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::GetDynamicProperties (  SyncMLDynamicProps &  dynamic_props  )  [pure virtual]
 

Gets the dynamic properties for this data store.

Parameters:
dynamic_props[out] : the dynamic properties for this data store.
Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::GetItemData (  const UINT32  item_id,
void *  item_data,
UINT32 &  item_data_length,
SyncMLItemMetaInfo *  item_meta_info = 0
)  [pure virtual]
 

Gets the data of the item with id item_id. Gives back the data in parameter item_data and meta data in parameter item_meta_info.

Parameters:
item_id[in] : The item id for the item.
item_data[out] : Pointer to the buffer for the item data.
item_data_length[in/out],: Input should be size of buffer, output the actual length of item data.
item_meta_info[out] : Pointer to the meta information of the item. Maybe 0.
Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::GetItemMetaInfo (  const UINT32  item_id,
SyncMLItemMetaInfo &  item_meta_info
)  [pure virtual]
 

Gets the meta info of the item with id item_id. Gives back the meta data in parameter item_meta_info.

Parameters:
item_id[in] : The item id for the item.
item_meta_info[out] : Meta information about the data of the item.
Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

Gets the static properties for this data store.

Returns:
data_store_props : properties of this data store.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::LockDataStore (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Locks the data store to prohibit any data changes by others than the SyncML application.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::OpenDatabase (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Opens the database. Has to be called by the SyncML application before data is read or written.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::Rollback (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Rollbacks the transaction and undos all the changes since StartTransaction was called.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual DBItemIterator* DBService::SearchDataItems (  const String &  search_grammar,
const String &  search_query
)  [pure virtual]
 

Get the iterator to the item ids based on search_grammer and search_query.

Parameters:
search_grammar[in] : the search grammar the query is specified in (e.g. "sql").
search_query[in] : the search query as a string.
Returns:
pointer to a DBItemIterator iterator for the items selected by the query. If the iterator isn't used any more, it has to be released using Release.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::StartTransaction (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Starts a transaction.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual BOOLEAN DBService::UnlockDataStore (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Unlocks the data store and allows changes by others than the SyncML application.

Returns:
TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

virtual UINT16 DBService::UpdateItem (  const UINT32  item_id,
const void *  item_data,
UINT32  item_data_length,
const SyncMLItemMetaInfo &  item_meta_info
)  [pure virtual]
 

Updates an item in the database with new data.

Parameters:
item_id[in] : The item id for the item.
item_data[in] : Data for the item.
item_data_length[in] : Length of the data for the item.
item_meta_info[in] : Meta information about the data for the item.
Returns:
Returns the response status code of the operation (see Response Status Codes in the SyncML Representation Protocol).
